attributes.name: description
attributes.content: China Railway Group Limited (CREC), based in Beijing, is a global powerhouse rooted in China's Ministry of Railways with a history of over a century. Specializing in engineering, industrial equipment manufacturing, real estate, and finance, CREC consistently ranks among the Fortune Global 500 and China's top 500 enterprises. Renowned for its expertise in railway projects, CREC has shaped China's infrastructure with extensive contributions to railways, expressways, and urban transit.

body.value: China Railway Group Limited (CREC), based in Beijing, is a global powerhouse rooted in China's Ministry of Railways with a history of over a century. Specializing in engineering, industrial equipment manufacturing, real estate, and finance, CREC consistently ranks among the Fortune Global 500 and China's top 500 enterprises. Renowned for its expertise in railway projects, CREC has shaped China's infrastructure with extensive contributions to railways, expressways, and urban transit. Internationally, CREC operates in over 90 countries across Asia, Africa, Europe, and South America, undertaking significant projects. Innovation-driven, CREC holds numerous patents and national awards, supported by national laboratories focused on high-speed railways, tunneling, and bridges. With a workforce exceeding 290,000 professionals, CREC drives global and domestic infrastructure development through a diversified portfolio in construction, manufacturing, and real estate.

attributes.content: The creation of a Permanent Secretariat of the Transport Sector Program (SP-PST) was conceived against the backdrop of restructuring and strengthening of the former Coordination of the second Transport Sector Program (PST2). Also the SP-PST draws its justification of the recommendations of stakeholders and technical and financial partners for the writing of the transport sector strategy document for the period 2011-2025.

body.value: The creation of a Permanent Secretariat of the Transport Sector Program (SP-PST) was conceived against the backdrop of restructuring and strengthening of the former Coordination of the second Transport Sector Program (PST2). Also the SP-PST draws its justification of the recommendations of stakeholders and technical and financial partners for the writing of the transport sector strategy document for the period 2011-2025. These recommendations are based on the need to establish a lasting structure which will contribute, in collaboration with the General Directorate of Sectoral Studies and Statistics, to the monitoring and evaluation of the implementation of the sectoral strategy.

attributes.content: On May 1, 1987, Katahira & Engineers International (KEI) was established mainly to contribute to the socioeconomic development and growth of developing countries. With its highly dedicated professional staff, KEI has since gained worldwide recognition as an effective consultant for successfully implementing international development projects.

body.value:
On May 1, 1987, Katahira & Engineers International (KEI) was established mainly to contribute to the socioeconomic development and growth of developing countries.

With its highly dedicated professional staff, KEI has since gained worldwide recognition as an effective consultant for successfully implementing international development projects.

In the past 35 years, KEI has been at the forefront of the implementation and completion of more than 900 JICA ODA grant aid, and other foreign-assisted development projects in some 60 countries worldwide, where it provided consultancy services for equipment management, business sustainability, technology transfer, detailed design, construction supervision, etc. in a wide variety of disciplines. Over the years, KEI has received high competence ratings as the consultant of completed projects from various donor agencies including ADB, the World Bank, and JICA, and has also received appreciation from the governments of satisfied recipient countries.

attributes.content: The Ethiopian Ministry of Culture and Tourism oversees the research, preservation, and promotion of Ethiopia's cultural heritage and tourist attractions, working with entities like ARCCH and EWCA. It strives to boost tourism by highlighting resources, developing facilities, and setting standards. Despite these efforts, challenges such as inadequate investment, security issues, and a fragmented strategy limit tourist appeal, often leading travelers to other destinations. Additionally, official visitor statistics are sometimes inflated by including transit passengers.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Agriculture, Water, and Land Reform focuses on managing and developing agricultural resources, water, and land policies to ensure a sustainable and productive sector. It promotes sustainable farming, boosts productivity, and supports research; manages water resources and addresses scarcity; oversees fair land distribution and tenure security; develops national policies and collaborates with stakeholders; and provides training and support to farmers.

body.value: The Ministry of Agriculture, Water, and Land Reform focuses on managing and developing agricultural resources, water, and land policies to ensure a sustainable and productive sector. It promotes sustainable farming, boosts productivity, and supports research; manages water resources and addresses scarcity; oversees fair land distribution and tenure security; develops national policies and collaborates with stakeholders; and provides training and support to farmers. Its key goals are to enhance agricultural productivity, ensure water security, promote sustainable land use, and support rural development.

attributes.content: The Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) ensures Kenya's national security through its three branches: the Kenya Army, the Kenya Navy, and the Kenya Air Force. The Army handles land-based operations such as counter-terrorism and peacekeeping, while the Navy secures the coastline, protects maritime resources, and addresses piracy from bases like Mombasa. The Air Force supports national defense with its fighter jets, transport aircraft, and surveillance planes.

body.value: The Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) ensures Kenya's national security through its three branches: the Kenya Army, the Kenya Navy, and the Kenya Air Force. The Army handles land-based operations such as counter-terrorism and peacekeeping, while the Navy secures the coastline, protects maritime resources, and addresses piracy from bases like Mombasa. The Air Force supports national defense with its fighter jets, transport aircraft, and surveillance planes. Beyond national duties, the KDF participates in regional peacekeeping missions under the African Union and United Nations, with involvement in South Sudan, Somalia, and the Democratic Republic of Congo. Governed by the Kenya Defence Forces Act, it also tackles internal security issues, engages in community service, and provides disaster relief.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ghana Shippers' Authority (GSA) has been a cornerstone of Ghana's maritime industry since its inception in 1974 by NRCD 254. Over the years, it has actively collaborated with both private and public entities within the maritime sector to fulfill its primary mission: protecting and promoting the interests of shippers in Ghana. This includes addressing issues related to ports, shipping, and inland transport to ensure safe, reliable, and cost-effective cargo handling.

body.value:
The Ghana Shippers' Authority (GSA) has been a cornerstone of Ghana's maritime industry since its inception in 1974 by NRCD 254. Over the years, it has actively collaborated with both private and public entities within the maritime sector to fulfill its primary mission: protecting and promoting the interests of shippers in Ghana. This includes addressing issues related to ports, shipping, and inland transport to ensure safe, reliable, and cost-effective cargo handling.

Initially operating under the name Ghana Shippers' Council, the organization underwent a name change to Ghana Shippers' Authority in alignment with the Laws of Ghana (Revised Edition), 1998 (Act 562). This change reflects the Council's evolution and aligns it with both the Constitution of the Republic of Ghana and the modern demands of the shipping industry.

The GSA functions under the ministerial oversight of the Ministry of Transport and is structured into three tiers: the Governing Board, the Import/Export Shipper Committees, and the Secretariat.

Initially operating under the name Ghana Shippers' Council, the organization underwent a name change to Ghana Shippers' Authority in alignment with the Laws of Ghana (Revised Edition), 1998 (Act 562). This change reflects the Council's evolution and aligns it with both the Constitution of the Republic of Ghana and the modern demands of the shipping industry.

The GSA functions under the ministerial oversight of the Ministry of Transport and is structured into three tiers: the Governing Board, the Import/Export Shipper Committees, and the Secretariat.
